data.oai_dc:dc: For each sampled individual that had both full siblings (FS) and half-siblings (HS), its age (adult or nymph), gender (female or male), strain (Rennes or Dijon), mother (grandmothers and mothers of the F2 generation), and raw cuticular hydrocarbon peak areas (25 CHCs commonly found on the cuticle of Blattella germanica).
kin recognition|aggregation|cuticular hydrocarbons|animal model|odor–gene covariance|quantitative genetics
